posts.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: my personal favourite challenges
posts.description: This year I participated in the first edition of Advent of TypeScript created by TypeHero. In this  new series of article I will show my solutions to the challenges I liked the most.

posts.title: SwiftUI and the Text concatenations super powers
posts.description: Do you need a way to compose beautiful text with images and custom font like you are used with  Attributed String. The Text component has everything we need to create some sort of 'attributed text' directly in SwiftUI. Let's go!!!

posts.title: Widget iOS: how to fix the image bundling problem
posts.description: Discover how we had a long day debugging WidgetKit problems with images.

posts.title: Use SwiftUI Path and Shape to render your svg files: a practical example
posts.description: Let's have some fun with SwiftUI by drawing an inspiration title component leveraging Path and Shape.

posts.title: Create a microfrontend app using module federation and dynamic configuration
posts.description: We are used to the term microservice in the backend world. Is there a way to achieve the same architectural indipendence in the frontend world? Let's see how it is possible to create a microfrontend app by leveraging Webpack 5 module federation with a widget-based custom remote configuration.

posts.title: A custom module for Jackson object mapper using Java Service Provider
posts.description: Sometimes you have custom Jackson object mapper imported from external modules/libraries. How can you  customize their serialization/deserialization? Let's go to discover the power of Java Service Provider Interface.

posts.title: A simple react hook to detect scroll direction
posts.description: How do you detect scroll direction using React hooks? Let’s find out in this new post.

posts.title: Contract testing asynchronous messaging with Pact and MockK
posts.description: In the last weeks I worked with my colleague Felice Giovinazzo on a new feature for the refund  process. Let’s see how we used pact to test a message-based interaction between two microservices with Pact

posts.title: A Domain Driven Design dictionary for newbies
posts.description: In the last months, I started to hear a lot of stuff about Domain Driven Design. What is DDD? What does it try to solve? This is a post for all the newbies (like me) that are searching for a definition of what DDD is, which are its main parts and what is its main goal.

posts.title: How to test your Swift source code on Linux: locally and on Github Actions
posts.description: Quick tips (useful for open source projects) for testing your Swift source code on Linux locally  and with Github Actions.

posts.title: Better organize tests and run them against multiple configuration with Xcode Test Plan
posts.description: Recently I added a lot of Unit and UI tests to RangeUISlider, one of my open source projects. Let's see how I grouped them and run them against multiple configurations with Xcode Test Plan.

posts.title: Unit testing in Kotlin with JUnit 5 and MockK
posts.description: I recently discovered MockK, a mocking library created for Kotlin. Let's see how it is possible to write modern unit tests with MockK + JUnit 5.

posts.title: Spring Boot + Kotlin Rest client cheatsheet: RestTemplate and Webclient
posts.description: During the last months I worked a lot with Spring Boot backend applications. In this post I explain how you can consume a REST api from a Spring Boot application using RestTemplate and (the new) WebClient.

posts.title: Swift Package Manager: bundling resources with a Swift Package
posts.description: Recently I upgraded my ID3TagEditor swift package to the latest Swift tools version (5.3). During the upgraded I discovered that now you can bundle resources with your Swift package. In this post I will show you how  you can do this, and also an interesting trick in order to be able to build a project as a Swift Package and as a standard project from Xcode.

posts.title: Create a service worker with Workbox, Webpack and TypeScript
posts.description: Recently I migrated my website to Webpack and TypeScript. I decided also to give a try to Workbox, a set of Google libraries to improve the creation of a Progressive Web App. Let's see how easy it is to create a PWA with this tools.

posts.title: Use UIKit components in SwiftUI: UIViewControllerRepresentable and UIViewRepresentable
posts.description: Do you know that it is possible to use UKit components in SwiftUI? Let's see how you can use UIViewRepresentable and UIViewControllerRepresentable to use your UIKit based component or to fill the gap for missing SwiftUI API.

posts.title: Lazy loading of JavaScript modules by using dynamic imports and code splitting with Webpack
posts.description: Most of the time you have a big JavaScript codebase for your website but you need only a small fraction of it when a page is requested. Is it possible to load chunks of JavaScript code only when they are really needed? Yes you can with Webpack and its code splitting feature based on a syntax equal to the one of ES2020 dynamic imports.

posts.title: Add dark mode support on your website with SASS and prefers-color-scheme media query
posts.description: Dark mode support has been around for quite some time. Let's see how you can create a light theme and a dark theme for your website that will be selected automatically based on the user system preference.

posts.title: How to: create your SUPER simple dependency injector container in Swift
posts.description: There are a lot of dependency injection framework in the open source swift world with really cool features like object graph, persistence etc. But what if all you need is a lightweight dependencies container? In this post I will show you how to create it by leveraging the Metatype Type, Generics, the Hashable protocol and the Equatable protocol.

posts.title: Create a custom TabBar in SwiftUI
posts.description: SwiftUI has been introduced by Apple during the last WWDC. I started to use it for a personal project to understand its potential. Let's see how I used SwiftUI to create a custom TabBar with modal and detail navigation.

posts.title: How to: enable Hermes JavaScript engine in your React Native app
posts.description: React native 0.60.4 has a new cool feature for Android: a new JavaScript engine called Hermes. Let's see how you can turn it on in your React Native application to get all its benefits.

posts.title: Implement offline tracking with Google Analytics in your Progressive Web App
posts.description: PWA offer great native alike offline capabilities. But what about tracking? In this tutorial I will show you how simple it is to implement offline tracking with Google Analytics in your PWA.

posts.title: Implement a pull to refresh component for you web application
posts.description: Implementing a pull to refresh component in vanilla js for your progressive web app (PWA) it's really easy. Let's do it now!

posts.title: Web to native code communication on Android using JavaScript Interfaces
posts.description: Javascript Interface can be helpful when you need to call native code from a webview on Android.

posts.title: Web to native code communication on iOS using WKScriptMessageHandler
posts.description: Did you know that it is possible to call Swift/Objective-C code from the JavaScript code of a web page displayed inside a WKWebView?

posts.title: Clean Code: functions
posts.description: Let's learn how to write function in a clean way.

posts.title: Publish your Progressive Web App to the Google Play Store
posts.description: You can now publish your progressive web apps to the Google Play Store using Trusted Web Activities without writing a single line of Java/Kotlin code.

posts.title: Intersection Observer API: speed up your web applications with lazy loading
posts.description: Intersection Observer can improve your web application performance by helping you to implement lazy loading of resources inside your web pages.

posts.title: Flow, the static type checker for Javascript: how to use it and a brief comparison with TypeScript
posts.description: Sick and tired of TypeScript? Give a chance to Flow, the JavaScript static type checker from Facebook.

posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about Cycles.

posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about about how to do other cool stuff with lights in Blender.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: light - part 1
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about light.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: textures - part 2
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk other about textures techniques.

posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about textures.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: materials
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about materials.

posts.title: Progressive Web App: an app-like experience for your website users
posts.description: In this post I will talk about how I transformed my blog on Github Pages and Jekyll into a PWA.

posts.title: End to end (e2e) cross platform testing for your mobile apps with Appium
posts.description: In this post I will talk about how to use Appium to write cross platform end to end tests for you mobile apps.

posts.title: Create a Swift library compatible with the Swift Package Manager for macOS and Linux
posts.description: In this post I will talk about how to create a Swift library with the Swift Package Manager for macOS and Linux.

posts.title: React Native: a simple architecture for Native Modules communication with your UIViewController on iOS
posts.description: In this post I will talk about a simple architecture for communication between React Native Native modules (aka bridges) and your native code on iOS.

posts.title: React Native: a simple architecture for Native Modules communication with your Activities and Fragments on Android
posts.description: In this post I will talk about a simple architecture for communication between React Native Native modules (aka bridges) and your native code on Android.

posts.title: My first experience as speaker at Voxxed Days 2018: a talk about React, React Native and Typescript
posts.description: In this post I will talk about my first experience as a speaker at a conference: a talk about React, React Native and Typescript with Alessandro Romano.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: outliner, layers, groups, hierarchies and scenes
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about outliner, layers, groups, hierarchies and scenes.

posts.title: Refactoring: a real case of a nested if structure transformed into a chain of responsibility
posts.description: In this post my colleague Francesco Bonfadelli will show you how to transform a nested if structure into a chain of responsibility.

posts.title: Rich iOS notifications with Notification Content App Extension
posts.description: In this post I will talk about iOS notification customization with Notification Content App Extension.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: advanced modeling
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will talk about advanced modeling in Blender.

posts.title: Design thinking and Design sprint: embrace you creativity
posts.description: In this new post I will talk about my experience with design sprint and design thinking during a workshop I attended.

posts.title: Eat Your Own Dog Food: distribute a beta version of your iOS app using Apple Enterprise Developer Program
posts.description: In this post I will show you how to distribute a beta version of your iOS app using Apple Enterprise Developer Program.

posts.title: React Native + Typescript, love at first sight. Setup in an existing app
posts.description: In this post I will show you how to setup React Native + Typescript in an existing app and I will show you how powerful they are when used together.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: introduction to basics of modeling - part 2
posts.description: In this new post of the series Blender tutorial I will continue to talk about the fundamental of modeling in Blender.

posts.title: Asynchronous testing in Swift
posts.description: In this post I will talk about asynchronous testing in Swift.

posts.title: Mp3ID3Tagger: a native macOS app to edit the ID3 tag of your mp3 files written using RxSwift and RxCocoa
posts.description: The third of a short series of post in which I describe my two latest project: ID3TagEditor and Mp3ID3Tagger. In this post I will talk about Mp3ID3Tagger, a macOS application to edit id3 tag of your mp3 files.

posts.title: ID3TagEditor: a Swift framework to read and write ID3 tag of your mp3 files for macOS, iOS, tvOS and watchOS
posts.description: The second of a short series of post in which I describe my two latest project: ID3TagEditor and Mp3ID3Tagger. In this post I will talk about ID3TagEditor framework.

posts.title: The birth of ID3TagEditor and Mp3ID3Tagger and my journey into the ID3 tag standard
posts.description: The first of a short series of post in which I describe my two latest project: ID3TagEditor and Mp3ID3Tagger. In this post I will talk about why I started to develop them.

posts.title: Clean Code: data structures vs objects and the law of demeter
posts.description: In this post I will talk about clean code: data structures, objects vs procedural and the law of demeter.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: introduction to basics of modeling - part 1
posts.description: In this new post of the Blender tutorial series I will talk about the fundamental of modeling in Blender.

posts.title: Golden master testing aka Characterization test: a powerful tool to win your fight against legacy code
posts.description: In this post I will talk about golden master test aka characterization test: what it is and how to use it.

posts.title: Code review: what it is and why it matters
posts.description: In this post I will talk about code review: what it is and why it matters.

posts.title: Blender tutorial: selecting and transforming objects
posts.description: Second post of the Blender tutorial series. This time we will learn how to select and move objects.

posts.title: React Native: the power of RCTBundleURLProvider to build, run and debug on an iOS device from Xcode
posts.description: Do you know how to debug your react native app on a iOS device?

posts.title: Blender tutorial: user interface
posts.description: In this new series of post I will talk about learning to use Blender, the famous 3D computer graphics software. A series of tutorial for beginners (like me).

posts.title: Android Studio vs Xcode vs AppCode: a brief comparison about coding speed
posts.description: In this post I will compare the coding speed that it is possible to achieve in some JetBrains IDEs and XCode, in terms of code creation and refactoring.

posts.title: SceneKit and physically based rendering
posts.description: Let's try to build a scene using SceneKit and its physically based rendering features.

posts.title: React Native: use multiple RCTRootView instances in an existing iOS app
posts.description: In this post I show you how it is possible to use multiple RCTRootView instances in an existing iOS app.

posts.title: Physically based rendering: informal introduction
posts.description: In this post I will give you an informal introduction about Physically based rendering.

posts.title: React Native and Realm: custom manual link for an iOS app with custom directory structure
posts.description: In this post I will show you how to install realm as a dependency in a React Native project with custom folders structure without using react-native link command.

posts.title: Model View Presenter on Android: unit test for everything
posts.description: In this post I will talk about the model view presenter architectural pattern and how it can improve you unit test and your TDD workflow when developing an Android application.

posts.title: Clean Code: meaningful names
posts.description: In this post I will talk about clean code and how important are the name you choose while you're developing software.

posts.title: How to calculate the reflection vector
posts.description: In this post I will talk about reflection vector used in some lighting models, for example the Phong reflection model. I will show you how this vector is calculated.

posts.title: Model View Presenter on iOS: no more excuses, write your unit test
posts.description: In this post I will talk about the model view presenter architectural pattern and how it can improve you unit test and your TDD workflow when developing an iOS application.

posts.title: Phong reflection model
posts.description: In this post I will talk about phong reflection model: one of the oldest and most popular lighting model in computer graphics.

posts.title: A first approach to contract test
posts.description: In this post I will talk about contract test: what they are and how you can use them.

posts.title: Swift Closure: demystifying @escaping and @autoclosure attributes
posts.description: In this post I will talk about Swift closure and the potential of the @escaping and @autoclosure attributes

posts.title: Swift Closure: definition and syntax
posts.description: In this post I will talk about Swift closure: what they are and their syntax

posts.title: A physically based scene with three.js
posts.description: In this post I will show you how to create a scene using ThreeJS with support for Physically Based Rendering

posts.title: Github Pages and Jekyll: chicio coding birth
posts.description: So, how was created this blog? Let's go through the development process of its creation. Boring and fun at the same time.
